description: Numbers that are congruent to {0, 1, 6} mod 7.
comments: Nonnegative m such that floor(k*m^2/7) = k*floor(m^2/7), where k = 4, 5 or 6. See also the comment in A047299. [_Bruno Berselli_, Dec 03 2015]
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,1,-1).
mathematica: Select[Range[0, 120], Function[k, Mod[#, 7] == k] /@ Or[0, 1, 6] &] (* or *) Select[Range[0, 120], Function[k, Floor[k (#^2/7)] == k Floor[#^2/7]] /@ Or[4, 5, 6] &] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 03 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
